X-Yahoo-Profile: aaronjosephsimon

Barbara,

A few points (hopefully one of these will help):

1) I think that newer versions of Cantera do not work well with Matlab
releases earlier than 6.5 (I haven't done extensive testing, but I
work with students who have various old versions, and 6.5 seems to be
the cutoff for stability).  So you should certainly be using Matlab 7
if you're going to use Cantera 1.6.0.

2) You can use much of Cantera without python, but all of your thermo
input needs to come from .xml files (the conversion from .cti to .xml
is the python-dependent step).  I think that the 1.6.0 installer comes
with a few input files already converted, but if not, I can send you a
few examples.  They should be in your C:\Program Files\Common
Files\Cantera\Data directory.  With a fresh install of 1.6.0, you
should be able to type:

>> G = idealGasMix('gri30.xml')

at the matlab prompt and get things to work from there.  Note that the
tutorials and demos will NOT work because they use the
Python-dependent command:

>> G = idealGasMix('gri30.cti')

3) Python is very simple to install, and it's free, so don't be afraid
to give that a try to get Cantera's full functionality.  There are a
couple of steps involved in setting the path correctly in your
operating system, but they're pretty well documented in various
versions of the Cantera installation instructions.

Good Luck!

-A.J.


--- In cantera@yahoogroups.com, "pesentib_fpms" <Barbara.Pesenti@f...>
wrote:
> Hi all,
> I'm a very new user of the Cantera user's Group but I currently use 
> a very old version of the Matlab files series of Cantera (the
zipped 
> file was cantera-mlab-10.zip, downloaded in 2002).  I used it the 
> last time with Matlab 6, one year ago...and it still worked 
> properly.  I try to re-use it but I always get the following error 
> message:
> 
> Unable to load mex file: C:\Documents and Settings\Barbara 
> Pesenti\Mes documents\Utils\Utilitaires 
> Pphys\Cantera\Cantera_Matlab\cantera-mlab-10
> \cantera\@Phase\private\newphase.dll.
> 
> I tried to change the path, to move the files, to work in the 
> directory where the files are,... but noting works.
> 
> Does anyone still use this old version somewhere and can advise me?
 
> 
> If not, I'd like to know how to use the latest release of Cantera
in 
> Matlab.  I have downloaded and installed the new toolbox in 
> \Cantera\MATLAB\toolbox\cantera, but it appearently needs Python to 
> run inside Matlab.  Python was not necessary with the older version 
> of the matlab routines and I am therefore a little bit confused
with 
> the new release (I'm really not familiar with Python).  Could you 
> please tell me how I should proceed to make the latest Cantera 
> Toolbox run into Matlab (6 or 7)?
> 
> Thanks in advance to anyone who can help,
> 
> Regards,
> 
> Barbara
